text: As the world confronts #COVID_19, our nation through @SouthCom continues to lend a helping hand to our regional allies. #Jamaica received a mobile field hospital reaffirming our nations’ strong friendship and bilateral relations. 🇯🇲🇺🇸 https://twitter.com/southcom/status/1309253357668904964 QT @Southcom #SOUTHCOM's Adm. Craig Faller was honored to join @AmbassadorUS_JA in Kingston to hand over a large field hospital to #Jamaica to aid their #COVID19 response. .@FEMA has announced it will reimburse @SMHCS more than $1.8 million for emergency response measures as a result of #COVID19.
.@FEMA has announced it will reimburse #JupiterIsland more than $6.3 million for sand renourishment as a result of #HurricaneDorian.
.@FEMA has announced it will reimburse #FranklinCounty more than $4.1 million for repairs to Alligator Point Road as a result of #HurricaneMichael.

In the United States the president does not determine who can or cannot vote and what ballots will be counted.

That may be what is done in other authoritarian countries.

But it is not and will not be done in America.

This is a democracy.

Do not assume enough people will turn out to vote to defeat Trump and that you can stay home.

Every vote matters.

Make a plan to vote right now. http://vote.org
